Sentencas: In situ Raman spectroscopy and linear sweep voltammetry were used to characterize graphite formation on Ni/YSZ cermet anodes in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) operating at 715 degrees C.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: The membrane electrode assemblies were run continuously with Ar-diluted H-2 and exposed to intermittent bursts of hydrocarbons.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: The appearance and disappearance of carbon deposits was monitored as a function of cell potential and hydrocarbon fuel identity.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: The hydrocarbon fuels employed in these studies included methane, ethylene, and propylene.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: Kinetic modeling predicts that of these three fuels, propylene is the most reactive under the conditions of the SOFC experiments.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: Methane was predicted to be virtually unreactive in the gas phase.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: Limited exposure of the SOFC anode to methane led to no observable carbon deposits and no appreciable change in SOFC electrochemical performance.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: Extended exposure to a continuous methane feed resulted in the formation of highly ordered graphite as evidenced by a single feature (assigned as the G band) at 1585 cm(-1) in the Raman spectrum.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: The addition of ethylene to the incident fuel leads initially to the formation of highly ordered graphite as evidenced by the rapid growth of the G band and a small D band (at 1365 cm(-1)) in the Raman spectrum.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: Subsequent additions of ethylene created more disorder and led to deteriorating SOFC performance.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: Small amounts of propylene added to the fuel feed formed disordered carbon having significant amounts of tetrahedrally coordinated carbon, and SOFC performance suffered reversible degradation.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: Applying an overpotential to the anode led to the disappearance of carbon deposits with the intensity of the D band diminishing more rapidly than the G band.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation

Sentencas: The disappearance rates depended directly on the anode overpotential.
Titulo: Hydrocarbon fuels in solid oxide fuel cells: In situ Raman studies of graphite formation and oxidation
